parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> System </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Creates a list of supported operators and type. Each field of array has the format: "x:name" Where x can be:
*'t' - type
*'n' - [[SQF_syntax#Nular_Operators|nullar]] operator
*'u' - [[SQF_syntax#Unary_Operators|unary]] operator
*'b' - [[SQF_syntax#Binary_Operators|binary]] operator.

'name' is the operator or type name (in case operator, type of input operands is included). 
''mask'' parameter can be an empty string, or one of field. In this case, function returns empty array, if operator is not included in the list. Limited wildcard support is available. Type ''x'' may be replaced with ''*'', meaning all types. For the ''mask'' partial match may be used, like ''abc*'', meaning any operators starting with 'abc' are reported, for example: 
* <tt>""</tt> - list all types and commands
* <tt>"t:*"</tt> - list all types
* <tt>"*:&lt;command&gt;*"</tt> - list all entries for script &lt;command&gt;
* <tt>"i:&lt;command&gt;"</tt> - (since Arma 3 v1.99.146528) extended information about script &lt;command&gt; in format: <br>&nbsp;&nbsp;<tt>[<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>[</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext>commandType, lowerCaseName, camelCaseName, description, example, exampleResult, returnType, leftArgType, rightArgType, commandSyntax (Since Arma 3 v2.01.146751)],...]</tt>
<tt>"i:*"</tt> is not a wildcard but returns information about the [[a_*_b|multiplication operator]] instead.
</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''supportInfo''' mask </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> mask: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - array with requested info or empty array [] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[supportInfo]] "b:select*";   //Returns ["b:ARRAY select SCALAR","b:ARRAY select BOOL","b:CONFIG select SCALAR"]</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Return all available commands: <code>_commands = [[supportInfo]] "";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[productVersion]], [[requiredVersion]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 24, 2014 - 19:27 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To get the list of all supported commands in Arma 3 one can simply:
<code>{[[diag_log]] _x} [[forEach]] [[supportInfo]] "";</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on October 19, 2020 - 10:23 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:7erra|7erra]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This code will return the detailed information on all commands as if <tt>supportInfo "i:*"</tt> would return all commands:
<code>_allCommands <template><title>=</title></template> [];
[[supportInfo]] "" [[apply]] {
	_x [[splitString]] ":" [[params]] ["_t", "_x"];
	[[if]] (_t !<template><title>=</title></template> "t") [[then]] {
		_x <template><title>=</title></template> _x [[splitString]] " ";
		_command <template><title>=</title></template> [[switch]] [[count]] _x [[do]] {
			[[case]] 1;
			[[case]] 2: {_x[[a_hash_b|#]]0};
			[[case]] 3: {_x[[a_hash_b|#]]1};
			[[default]] {[[nil]]};
		};
		_allCommands [[pushBackUnique]] _command;
	};
};
_allCommands [[sort]] [[true]];
_allCommands <template><title>=</title></template> _allCommands [[apply]] {
	[[supportInfo]] [[format]]["i:%1", _x]
};
_allCommands </code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
